q: Which of the following is a semantic HTML5 tag?
What will be displayed on the webpage when the following code is executed?
c:
<video width='320' height='240' controls>
  <source src='video.mp4' type='video/mp4'>
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
o: Only the text 'Your browser does not support the video tag.'

q: Which of the following is NOT a valid HTML5 semantic tag?
What does the following HTML5 code snippet do?
c:
<canvas id='myCanvas' width='200' height='100'></canvas>
<script>
  var canvas = document.getElementById('myCanvas');
  var ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
  ctx.fillStyle = 'red';
  ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 150, 80);
</script>
o: Draws a red rectangle on a canvas
Shows an error due to missing attributes

o: It provides a way to draw graphics using JavaScript
It is used to create responsive layouts

q: What does the following code do?
c:
<canvas id='canvas' width='200' height='100'></canvas>
<script>
  var canvas = document.getElementById('canvas');
  var ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
  ctx.arc(100, 50, 40, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
  ctx.stroke();
</script>
o: Draws a circle outline on the canvas
Displays a plain canvas without graphics

q: What will be the output of the following canvas drawing code?
c:
<canvas id='canvas' width='400' height='200'></canvas>
<script>
  var canvas = document.getElementById('canvas');
  var ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.arc(200, 100, 50, 0, Math.PI * 2);
  ctx.fillStyle = 'green';
  ctx.fill();
</script>
o: A green filled circle appears on the canvas
A red filled circle appears on the canvas
A green outlined circle appears on the canvas
